title: Everyday English Course 102
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What is the man?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: What can I do for you?
W: Is Mrs. Brown in?
M: No. She is not in, I'm afraid.
W: Could you take a message for her, please?
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: What can I do for you?
W: Is Mrs. Brown in?
M: No. She is not in, I'm afraid.
W: Could you take a message for her, please?
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: What can I do for you?
W: Is Mrs. Brown in?
M: No. She is not in, I'm afraid.
W: Could you take a message for her, please?
{a}

variables.a: Who is the woman hoping to get in touch with?
What will Dorothy do on the weekend?
Where does the conversation most likely take place?

answerOptions: She has been longing to attend Harvard University.
She'll consult Dr. Garcia about entering graduate school.
She has finished her project with Dr. Garcia's help.
instances.correctAnswer: She'll consult Dr. Garcia about entering graduate school.

variables.a: What do you learn about the woman from the conversation?

answerOptions: Read an article on political science.
Present a different theory to the class.

variables.a: What does the woman tell the man he must do?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Here we are. We're in good time.
W: Can I see the letter? I just want to check the description about him.
M: Oh, don't worry. We'll soon recognize him. Anyway, he's bound to have plenty of luggage!
{a}

M: Here we are. We're in good time.

variables.a: Where are the two persons most likely now?

answerOptions: He'll take it because he likes it.
He'll take it even though he doesn't like it.
He won't take it because he doesn't like it.
instances.correctAnswer: He'll take it because he likes it.

variables.a: What will the man probably do?

answerOptions: He's speaking to someone else on the telephone.
instances.correctAnswer: He's speaking to someone else on the telephone.

variables.a: What's Mr. Wang doing?

answerOptions: The woman is going to hold a big party tomorrow.
The man has no idea what the right thing to do is.
The man offers to drive the woman to the party.
instances.correctAnswer: The man offers to drive the woman to the party.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: How often does the woman go home to see her patents?

answerOptions: The police wants to talk to the main actor.
The main actor forgot to come.
The main actor is delayed by traffic.
instances.correctAnswer: The main actor is delayed by traffic.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?
What is the woman doing now?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Are you going to New York by car or by train?
W: Oh, I had planned to drive a car there, but now I've changed my mind.
M: What?
W: I think flying will be more comfortable.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Are you going to New York by car or by train?
W: Oh, I had planned to drive a car there, but now I've changed my mind.

W: I think flying will be more comfortable.
{a}

variables.a: How will the woman go to New York?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: 796-3758.
M: Hello. James Clock speaking. May I have a word with Mary?
W: I'll just see if she's in.
M: Right you are.
W: I'm afraid she's not here.
{a}

variables.a: Who answered the phone?

answerOptions: He needs more than one cup of coffee.
He needs to sleep for three or four hours,
He wants to buy a set of coffee cups.
instances.correctAnswer: He needs more than one cup of coffee.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: I thought it was an awful book. Honestly, just because it said in the future doesn't mean it has to be so strange. I mean, for a romance, it was pretty weird. Don't you think?
W: No, not really. I enjoyed all the actions around their relationship. I thought it was really exciting.
M: Well, may be. But it took you away from what should've been the main point of the story: how they found each other.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:

M: Well, may be. But it took you away from what should've been the main point of the story: how they found each other.

variables.a: Listen to these people talking about a book. What kind of book are they discussing?

answerOptions: She will start a new job.
She has to take another training.
She is busy with her new job.
instances.correctAnswer: She is busy with her new job.

variables.a: Why can't the woman take her holiday?

answerOptions: He should make a compromise with his partner.
He should meet his partner in the mid-town.
instances.correctAnswer: He should make a compromise with his partner.

variables.a: What does the woman suggest?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: What's the temperature today?
M: It's fifteen degree centigrade.
W: Another cool day, isn't it? I wonder how long this comfortable weather will last.
M: It's just March. It will be hotter next month.
{a}

M: It's fifteen degree centigrade.

variables.a: What does the man think the weather will be like in April?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: How did the woman feel about the show?

answerOptions: She enjoys making up stories about other people.
She can never keep anything to herself for long.
She is eager to share news with the woman.
instances.correctAnswer: She is eager to share news with the woman.

variables.a: What do we learn about Sally from the conversation?
On which days next week will the man have examinations?
What time is it now?

answerOptions: She fell asleep before the program ended.
She especially enjoyed the end of the program.
She missed the beginning of the program.
instances.correctAnswer: She fell asleep before the program ended.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?
Why does the woman often eat in the restaurant?

answerOptions: He went through a stop sign.

variables.a: Why did the man receive a ticket?

answerOptions: The man is unlikely to find exactly what he desires.
The man is unlikely to live in the suburbs.
The man will probably have to buy a car.
instances.correctAnswer: The man is unlikely to find exactly what he desires.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?

answerOptions: The man isn't sure about the rehearsal.
It's better for the woman to wear a costume.
The woman would regret it if she wore a costume.
instances.correctAnswer: It's better for the woman to wear a costume.

variables.a: What can we learn from the dialogue?
What are they talking about?
